00140 /***************************************************************************/
00162 void USART_BaudrateAsyncSet(USART_TypeDef *usart,
00163                             uint32_t refFreq,
00164                             uint32_t baudrate,
00165                             USART_OVS_TypeDef ovs)
00166 {
00167   uint32_t clkdiv;
00168   uint32_t oversample;
00169 
00170   /* Inhibit divide by 0 */
00171   EFM_ASSERT(baudrate);
00172 
00173   /*
00174    * We want to use integer division to avoid forcing in float division
00175    * utils, and yet keep rounding effect errors to a minimum.
00176    *
00177    * CLKDIV in asynchronous mode is given by:
00178    *
00179    * CLKDIV = 256 * (fHFPERCLK/(oversample * br) - 1)
00180    * or
00181    * CLKDIV = (256 * fHFPERCLK)/(oversample * br) - 256
00182    *
00183    * The basic problem with integer division in the above formula is that
00184    * the dividend (256 * fHFPERCLK) may become higher than max 32 bit
00185    * integer. Yet, we want to evaluate dividend first before dividing in
00186    * order to get as small rounding effects as possible. We do not want
00187    * to make too harsh restrictions on max fHFPERCLK value either.
00188    *
00189    * One can possibly factorize 256 and oversample/br. However,
00190    * since the last 6 or 3 bits of CLKDIV are don't care, we can base our
00191    * integer arithmetic on the below formula
00192    *
00193    * CLKDIV / 64 = (4 * fHFPERCLK)/(oversample * br) - 4 (3 bits dont care)
00194    * or
00195    * CLKDIV / 8  = (32 * fHFPERCLK)/(oversample * br) - 32 (6 bits dont care)
00196    *
00197    * and calculate 1/64 of CLKDIV first. This allows for fHFPERCLK
00198    * up to 1GHz without overflowing a 32 bit value!
00199    */
00200 
00201   /* HFPERCLK used to clock all USART/UART peripheral modules */
00202   if (!refFreq)
00203   {
00204     refFreq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_HFPER);
00205   }
00206 
00207   /* Map oversampling */
00208   switch (ovs)
00209   {
00210     case USART_CTRL_OVS_X16:
00211       EFM_ASSERT(baudrate <= (refFreq / 16));
00212       oversample = 16;
00213       break;
00214 
00215     case USART_CTRL_OVS_X8:
00216       EFM_ASSERT(baudrate <= (refFreq / 8));
00217       oversample = 8;
00218       break;
00219 
00220     case USART_CTRL_OVS_X6:
00221       EFM_ASSERT(baudrate <= (refFreq / 6));
00222       oversample = 6;
00223       break;
00224 
00225     case USART_CTRL_OVS_X4:
00226       EFM_ASSERT(baudrate <= (refFreq / 4));
00227       oversample = 4;
00228       break;
00229 
00230     default:
00231       /* Invalid input */
00232       EFM_ASSERT(0);
00233       return;
00234   }
00235 
00236   /* Calculate and set CLKDIV with fractional bits.
00237    * The addend (oversample*baudrate)/2 in the first line is to round the
00238    * divisor up by half the divisor before the division in order to reduce the
00239    * integer division error, which consequently results in a higher baudrate
00240    * than desired. */
00241 #if defined(_USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK) && (_USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK >= 0x7FFFF8UL)
00242   clkdiv  = 32 * refFreq + (oversample * baudrate) / 2;
00243   clkdiv /= (oversample * baudrate);
00244   clkdiv -= 32;
00245   clkdiv *= 8;
00246 #else
00247   clkdiv  = 4 * refFreq + (oversample * baudrate) / 2;
00248   clkdiv /= (oversample * baudrate);
00249   clkdiv -= 4;
00250   clkdiv *= 64;
00251 #endif
00252 
00253   /* Verify that resulting clock divider is within limits */
00254   EFM_ASSERT(clkdiv <= _USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK);
00255 
00256   /* If EFM_ASSERT is not enabled, make sure we don't write to reserved bits */
00257   clkdiv &= _USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK;
00258 
00259   usart->CTRL  &= ~_USART_CTRL_OVS_MASK;
00260   usart->CTRL  |= ovs;
00261   usart->CLKDIV = clkdiv;
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 /***************************************************************************/
00293 uint32_t USART_BaudrateCalc(uint32_t refFreq,
00294                             uint32_t clkdiv,
00295                             bool syncmode,
00296                             USART_OVS_TypeDef ovs)
00297 {
00298   uint32_t oversample;
00299   uint64_t divisor;
00300   uint64_t factor;
00301   uint64_t remainder;
00302   uint64_t quotient;
00303   uint32_t br;
00304 
00305   /* Mask out unused bits */
00306   clkdiv &= _USART_CLKDIV_MASK;
00307 
00308   /* We want to use integer division to avoid forcing in float division */
00309   /* utils, and yet keep rounding effect errors to a minimum. */
00310 
00311   /* Baudrate calculation depends on if synchronous or asynchronous mode */
00312   if (syncmode)
00313   {
00314     /*
00315      * Baudrate is given by:
00316      *
00317      * br = fHFPERCLK/(2 * (1 + (CLKDIV / 256)))
00318      *
00319      * which can be rewritten to
00320      *
00321      * br = (128 * fHFPERCLK)/(256 + CLKDIV)
00322      */
00323     oversample = 1; /* Not used in sync mode, ie 1 */
00324     factor     = 128;
00325   }
00326   else
00327   {
00328     /*
00329      * Baudrate in asynchronous mode is given by:
00330      *
00331      * br = fHFPERCLK/(oversample * (1 + (CLKDIV / 256)))
00332      *
00333      * which can be rewritten to
00334      *
00335      * br = (256 * fHFPERCLK)/(oversample * (256 + CLKDIV))
00336      *
00337      * First of all we can reduce the 256 factor of the dividend with
00338      * (part of) oversample part of the divisor.
00339      */
00340 
00341     switch (ovs)
00342     {
00343       case USART_CTRL_OVS_X16:
00344         oversample = 1;
00345         factor     = 256 / 16;
00346         break;
00347 
00348       case USART_CTRL_OVS_X8:
00349         oversample = 1;
00350         factor     = 256 / 8;
00351         break;
00352 
00353       case USART_CTRL_OVS_X6:
00354         oversample = 3;
00355         factor     = 256 / 2;
00356         break;
00357 
00358       default:
00359         oversample = 1;
00360         factor     = 256 / 4;
00361         break;
00362     }
00363   }
00364 
00365   /*
00366    * The basic problem with integer division in the above formula is that
00367    * the dividend (factor * fHFPERCLK) may become larger than a 32 bit
00368    * integer. Yet we want to evaluate dividend first before dividing in
00369    * order to get as small rounding effects as possible. We do not want
00370    * to make too harsh restrictions on max fHFPERCLK value either.
00371    *
00372    * For division a/b, we can write
00373    *
00374    * a = qb + r
00375    *
00376    * where q is the quotient and r is the remainder, both integers.
00377    *
00378    * The orignal baudrate formula can be rewritten as
00379    *
00380    * br = xa / b = x(qb + r)/b = xq + xr/b
00381    *
00382    * where x is 'factor', a is 'refFreq' and b is 'divisor', referring to
00383    * variable names.
00384    */
00385 
00386   /* Divisor will never exceed max 32 bit value since clkdiv <= 0xFFFFF8 */
00387   /* and 'oversample' has been reduced to <= 3. */
00388   divisor = oversample * (256 + clkdiv);
00389 
00390   quotient  = refFreq / divisor;
00391   remainder = refFreq % divisor;
00392 
00393   /* factor <= 128 and since divisor >= 256, the below cannot exceed max */
00394   /* 32 bit value. However, factor * remainder can become larger than 32-bit */
00395   /* because of the size of _USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK on some families. */
00396   br = (uint32_t)(factor * quotient);
00397 
00398   /*
00399    * factor <= 128 and remainder < (oversample*(256 + clkdiv)), which
00400    * means dividend (factor * remainder) worst case is
00401    * 128 * (3 * (256 + _USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK)) = 0x1_8001_7400.
00402    */
00403   br += (uint32_t)((factor * remainder) / divisor);
00404 
00405   return br;
00406 }

00409 /***************************************************************************/
00423 uint32_t USART_BaudrateGet(USART_TypeDef *usart)
00424 {
00425   uint32_t          freq;
00426   USART_OVS_TypeDef ovs;
00427   bool              syncmode;
00428 
00429   if (usart->CTRL & USART_CTRL_SYNC)
00430   {
00431     syncmode = true;
00432   }
00433   else
00434   {
00435     syncmode = false;
00436   }
00437 
00438   /* HFPERCLK used to clock all USART/UART peripheral modules */
00439   freq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_HFPER);
00440   ovs  = (USART_OVS_TypeDef)(usart->CTRL & _USART_CTRL_OVS_MASK);
00441   return USART_BaudrateCalc(freq, usart->CLKDIV, syncmode, ovs);
00442 }
00443 
00444 
00445 /***************************************************************************/
00472 void USART_BaudrateSyncSet(USART_TypeDef *usart, uint32_t refFreq, uint32_t baudrate)
00473 {
00474 #if defined(_USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK) && (_USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK >= 0x7FFFF8UL)
00475   uint64_t clkdiv;
00476 #else
00477   uint32_t clkdiv;
00478 #endif
00479 
00480   /* Inhibit divide by 0 */
00481   EFM_ASSERT(baudrate);
00482 
00483   /*
00484    * CLKDIV in synchronous mode is given by:
00485    *
00486    * CLKDIV = 256 * (fHFPERCLK/(2 * br) - 1)
00487    */
00488 
00489   /* HFPERCLK used to clock all USART/UART peripheral modules */
00490   if (!refFreq)
00491   {
00492     refFreq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_HFPER);
00493   }
00494 
00495 #if defined(_USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK) && (_USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK >= 0x7FFFF8UL)
00496   /* Calculate and set CLKDIV without fractional bits */
00497   clkdiv = 2 * baudrate;
00498   clkdiv = (0x100ULL * (uint64_t)refFreq) / clkdiv;
00499 
00500   /* Round up by not subtracting 256 and mask off fractional part */
00501   clkdiv &= ~0xFF;
00502 #else
00503   /* Calculate and set CLKDIV with fractional bits */
00504   clkdiv  = 2 * refFreq;
00505   clkdiv += baudrate - 1;
00506   clkdiv /= baudrate;
00507   clkdiv -= 4;
00508   clkdiv *= 64;
00509   /* Make sure we don't use fractional bits by rounding CLKDIV */
00510   /* up (and thus reducing baudrate, not increasing baudrate above */
00511   /* specified value). */
00512   clkdiv += 0xc0;
00513   clkdiv &= 0xffffff00;
00514 #endif
00515 
00516   /* Verify that resulting clock divider is within limits */
00517   EFM_ASSERT(!(clkdiv & ~_USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK));
00518 
00519   /* If EFM_ASSERT is not enabled, make sure we don't write to reserved bits */
00520   clkdiv &= _USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK;
00521 
00522   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&usart->CLKDIV, _USART_CLKDIV_DIV_MASK, clkdiv);
00523 }

00526 /***************************************************************************/
00541 void USART_Enable(USART_TypeDef *usart, USART_Enable_TypeDef enable)
00542 {
00543   uint32_t tmp;
00544 
00545   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00546   EFM_ASSERT( USART_REF_VALID(usart)
00547               || USARTRF_REF_VALID(usart)
00548               || UART_REF_VALID(usart) );
00549 
00550   /* Disable as specified */
00551   tmp        = ~((uint32_t) (enable));
00552   tmp       &= _USART_CMD_RXEN_MASK | _USART_CMD_TXEN_MASK;
00553   usart->CMD = tmp << 1;
00554 
00555   /* Enable as specified */
00556   usart->CMD = (uint32_t) (enable);
00557 }
00558 
00559 
00560 /***************************************************************************/
00583 void USART_InitAsync(USART_TypeDef *usart, const USART_InitAsync_TypeDef *init)
00584 {
00585   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00586   EFM_ASSERT( USART_REF_VALID(usart)
00587               || USARTRF_REF_VALID(usart)
00588               || UART_REF_VALID(usart) );
00589 
00590   /* Init USART registers to HW reset state. */
00591   USART_Reset(usart);
00592 
00593 #if defined(USART_INPUT_RXPRS) && defined(USART_CTRL_MVDIS)
00594   /* Disable majority vote if specified. */
00595   if (init->mvdis)
00596   {
00597     usart->CTRL |= USART_CTRL_MVDIS;
00598   }
00599 
00600   /* Configure PRS input mode. */
00601   if (init->prsRxEnable)
00602   {
00603     usart->INPUT = (uint32_t) init->prsRxCh | USART_INPUT_RXPRS;
00604   }
00605 #endif
00606 
00607   /* Configure databits, stopbits and parity */
00608   usart->FRAME = (uint32_t)init->databits
00609                  | (uint32_t)init->stopbits
00610                  | (uint32_t)init->parity;
00611 
00612   /* Configure baudrate */
00613   USART_BaudrateAsyncSet(usart, init->refFreq, init->baudrate, init->oversampling);
00614 
00615 #if defined(_USART_TIMING_CSHOLD_MASK)
00616   usart->TIMING = ((init->autoCsHold << _USART_TIMING_CSHOLD_SHIFT)
00617                    & _USART_TIMING_CSHOLD_MASK)
00618                   | ((init->autoCsSetup << _USART_TIMING_CSSETUP_SHIFT)
00619                      & _USART_TIMING_CSSETUP_MASK);
00620   if (init->autoCsEnable)
00621   {
00622     usart->CTRL |= USART_CTRL_AUTOCS;
00623   }
00624 #endif
00625   /* Finally enable (as specified) */
00626   usart->CMD = (uint32_t)init->enable;
00627 }
00628 
00629 
00630 /***************************************************************************/
00654 void USART_InitSync(USART_TypeDef *usart, const USART_InitSync_TypeDef *init)
00655 {
00656   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00657   EFM_ASSERT( USART_REF_VALID(usart) || USARTRF_REF_VALID(usart) );
00658 
00659   /* Init USART registers to HW reset state. */
00660   USART_Reset(usart);
00661 
00662   /* Set bits for synchronous mode */
00663   usart->CTRL |= (USART_CTRL_SYNC)
00664                  | (uint32_t)init->clockMode
00665                  | (init->msbf ? USART_CTRL_MSBF : 0);
00666 
00667 #if defined(_USART_CTRL_AUTOTX_MASK)
00668   usart->CTRL |= init->autoTx ? USART_CTRL_AUTOTX : 0;
00669 #endif
00670 
00671 #if defined(_USART_INPUT_RXPRS_MASK)
00672   /* Configure PRS input mode. */
00673   if (init->prsRxEnable)
00674   {
00675     usart->INPUT = (uint32_t)init->prsRxCh | USART_INPUT_RXPRS;
00676   }
00677 #endif
00678 
00679   /* Configure databits, leave stopbits and parity at reset default (not used) */
00680   usart->FRAME = (uint32_t)init->databits
00681                  | USART_FRAME_STOPBITS_DEFAULT
00682                  | USART_FRAME_PARITY_DEFAULT;
00683 
00684   /* Configure baudrate */
00685   USART_BaudrateSyncSet(usart, init->refFreq, init->baudrate);
00686 
00687   /* Finally enable (as specified) */
00688   if (init->master)
00689   {
00690     usart->CMD = USART_CMD_MASTEREN;
00691   }
00692 
00693 #if defined(_USART_TIMING_CSHOLD_MASK)
00694   usart->TIMING = ((init->autoCsHold << _USART_TIMING_CSHOLD_SHIFT)
00695                    & _USART_TIMING_CSHOLD_MASK)
00696                   | ((init->autoCsSetup << _USART_TIMING_CSSETUP_SHIFT)
00697                      & _USART_TIMING_CSSETUP_MASK);
00698   if (init->autoCsEnable)
00699   {
00700     usart->CTRL |= USART_CTRL_AUTOCS;
00701   }
00702 #endif
00703 
00704   usart->CMD = (uint32_t)init->enable;
00705 }
00706 
00707 
00708 #if defined(USART0) || ((USART_COUNT == 1) && defined(USART1))
00709 /***************************************************************************/
00735 void USART_InitIrDA(const USART_InitIrDA_TypeDef *init)
00736 {
00737   #if (USART_COUNT == 1) && defined(USART1)
00738   USART_TypeDef *usart = USART1;
00739   #else
00740   USART_TypeDef *usart = USART0;
00741   #endif
00742 
00743   /* Init USART as async device */
00744   USART_InitAsync(usart, &(init->async));
00745 
00746   /* Set IrDA modulation to RZI (return-to-zero-inverted) */
00747   usart->CTRL |= USART_CTRL_TXINV;
00748 
00749   /* Invert Rx signal before demodulator if enabled */
00750   if (init->irRxInv)
00751   {
00752     usart->CTRL |= USART_CTRL_RXINV;
00753   }
00754 
00755   /* Configure IrDA */
00756   usart->IRCTRL |= (uint32_t)init->irPw
00757                    | (uint32_t)init->irPrsSel
00758                    | ((uint32_t)init->irFilt << _USART_IRCTRL_IRFILT_SHIFT)
00759                    | ((uint32_t)init->irPrsEn << _USART_IRCTRL_IRPRSEN_SHIFT);
00760 
00761   /* Enable IrDA */
00762   usart->IRCTRL |= USART_IRCTRL_IREN;
00763 }
00764 #endif
00765 
00766 
00767 #if defined(_USART_I2SCTRL_MASK)
00768 /***************************************************************************/
00797 void USART_InitI2s(USART_TypeDef *usart, USART_InitI2s_TypeDef *init)
00798 {
00799   USART_Enable_TypeDef enable;
00800 
00801   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00802   EFM_ASSERT(USART_I2S_VALID(usart));
00803 
00804   /* Override the enable setting. */
00805   enable            = init->sync.enable;
00806   init->sync.enable = usartDisable;
00807 
00808   /* Init USART as a sync device. */
00809   USART_InitSync(usart, &init->sync);
00810 
00811   /* Configure and enable I2CCTRL register acording to selected mode. */
00812   usart->I2SCTRL = (uint32_t)init->format
00813                    | (uint32_t)init->justify
00814                    | (init->delay    ? USART_I2SCTRL_DELAY    : 0)
00815                    | (init->dmaSplit ? USART_I2SCTRL_DMASPLIT : 0)
00816                    | (init->mono     ? USART_I2SCTRL_MONO     : 0)
00817                    | USART_I2SCTRL_EN;
00818 
00819   if (enable != usartDisable)
00820   {
00821     USART_Enable(usart, enable);
00822   }
00823 }
00824 #endif
00825 
00826 
00827 /***************************************************************************/
00836 void USART_InitPrsTrigger(USART_TypeDef *usart, const USART_PrsTriggerInit_TypeDef *init)
00837 {
00838   uint32_t trigctrl;
00839 
00840   /* Clear values that will be reconfigured  */
00841   trigctrl = usart->TRIGCTRL & ~(_USART_TRIGCTRL_RXTEN_MASK
00842                                  | _USART_TRIGCTRL_TXTEN_MASK
00843 #if defined(USART_TRIGCTRL_AUTOTXTEN)
00844                                  | _USART_TRIGCTRL_AUTOTXTEN_MASK
00845 #endif
00846                                  | _USART_TRIGCTRL_TSEL_MASK);
00847 
00848 #if defined(USART_TRIGCTRL_AUTOTXTEN)
00849   if (init->autoTxTriggerEnable)
00850   {
00851     trigctrl |= USART_TRIGCTRL_AUTOTXTEN;
00852   }
00853 #endif
00854   if (init->txTriggerEnable)
00855   {
00856     trigctrl |= USART_TRIGCTRL_TXTEN;
00857   }
00858   if (init->rxTriggerEnable)
00859   {
00860     trigctrl |= USART_TRIGCTRL_RXTEN;
00861   }
00862   trigctrl |= init->prsTriggerChannel;
00863 
00864   /* Enable new configuration */
00865   usart->TRIGCTRL = trigctrl;
00866 }
00867 
00868 
00869 /***************************************************************************/
00876 void USART_Reset(USART_TypeDef *usart)
00877 {
00878   /* Make sure the module exists on the selected chip */
00879   EFM_ASSERT( USART_REF_VALID(usart)
00880               || USARTRF_REF_VALID(usart)
00881               || UART_REF_VALID(usart) );
00882 
00883   /* Make sure disabled first, before resetting other registers */
00884   usart->CMD = USART_CMD_RXDIS | USART_CMD_TXDIS | USART_CMD_MASTERDIS
00885                | USART_CMD_RXBLOCKDIS | USART_CMD_TXTRIDIS | USART_CMD_CLEARTX
00886                | USART_CMD_CLEARRX;
00887   usart->CTRL      = _USART_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
00888   usart->FRAME     = _USART_FRAME_RESETVALUE;
00889   usart->TRIGCTRL  = _USART_TRIGCTRL_RESETVALUE;
00890   usart->CLKDIV    = _USART_CLKDIV_RESETVALUE;
00891   usart->IEN       = _USART_IEN_RESETVALUE;
00892   usart->IFC       = _USART_IFC_MASK;
00893 #if defined(_USART_ROUTEPEN_MASK) || defined(_UART_ROUTEPEN_MASK)
00894   usart->ROUTEPEN  = _USART_ROUTEPEN_RESETVALUE;
00895   usart->ROUTELOC0 = _USART_ROUTELOC0_RESETVALUE;
00896   usart->ROUTELOC1 = _USART_ROUTELOC1_RESETVALUE;
00897 #else
00898   usart->ROUTE     = _USART_ROUTE_RESETVALUE;
00899 #endif
00900 
00901   if (USART_IRDA_VALID(usart))
00902   {
00903     usart->IRCTRL = _USART_IRCTRL_RESETVALUE;
00904   }
00905 
00906 #if defined(_USART_INPUT_RESETVALUE)
00907   usart->INPUT = _USART_INPUT_RESETVALUE;
00908 #endif
00909 
00910 #if defined(_USART_I2SCTRL_RESETVALUE)
00911   if (USART_I2S_VALID(usart))
00912   {
00913     usart->I2SCTRL = _USART_I2SCTRL_RESETVALUE;
00914   }
00915 #endif
00916 }
00917

00919 /***************************************************************************/
00943 uint8_t USART_Rx(USART_TypeDef *usart)
00944 {
00945   while (!(usart->STATUS & USART_STATUS_RXDATAV))
00946     ;
00947 
00948   return (uint8_t)usart->RXDATA;
00949 }

00979     ;
00980 
00981   return (uint16_t)usart->RXDOUBLE;
00982 }

01051 /***************************************************************************/
01070 uint8_t USART_SpiTransfer(USART_TypeDef *usart, uint8_t data)
01071 {
01072   while (!(usart->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXBL))
01073     ;
01074   usart->TXDATA = (uint32_t)data;
01075   while (!(usart->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXC))
01076     ;
01077   return (uint8_t)usart->RXDATA;
01078 }
01079

01081 /***************************************************************************/
01104 void USART_Tx(USART_TypeDef *usart, uint8_t data)
01105 {
01106   /* Check that transmit buffer is empty */
01107   while (!(usart->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXBL))
01108     ;
01109   usart->TXDATA = (uint32_t)data;
01110 }

01180     ;

01204 void USART_TxExt(USART_TypeDef *usart, uint16_t data)
01205 {
01206   /* Check that transmit buffer is empty */
01207   while (!(usart->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXBL))
01208     ;
01209   usart->TXDATAX = (uint32_t)data;
